alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Botetourt (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 9:22PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall will impact portions of extreme northern Bedford and western Botetourt Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 920 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms with heavy rainfall extended from Fincastle to Daleville to Troutville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. Heavy rainfall. Dangerous cloud-to-ground lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized minor flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Buchanan... Troutville... Fincastle... Nace... Laymantown... Daleville... Lithia... Interstate 81 between mile-markers 150 and 156. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
